item.description:
Let's meet up for another evening of FREE classical music!

The New England Conservatory has a series of FREE symphony orchestra concerts at Jordan Hall each Wednesday night during the fall. The hall is absolutely beautiful, and the acoustics are amazing. I will always try to sit in the left-middle balcony section, since it affords a good view of the orchestra, and any pianist's hands should there be one.

This evening's program will be performed by the NEC Philharmonia Orchestra, conducted by guest conductor David Loebel. For more details about him and the concert, go to http://www.necmusic.e...

The concert starts at 8pm, but let's meet up at 7:30, so the group has a chance to socialize before the concert.

Directions to Jordan Hall:
The hall is located at the corner of Huntington and Gainsborough streets, about a block south of the Symphony T stop on the Green Line. (The last time I was there, there was black canvas covering the side of the building and the sidewalk, as I believe the facade is under repair.)


This evening's program will include:


  • Sibelius's Lemminkäinen Suite, Op. 22, "Legends" (listen to possible excerpt)
  • Walton's Concerto for Viola and Orchestra, with soloist Hanna Lee (listen to excerpt)
  • Dvorák's Symphony No.7 (final movement)
item.how_to_find_us: I will stand in the lobby until 7:45, after which I will either move upstairs to the left-middle balcony section (if it's open) or the left middle of the hall past the overhang if it's not.
item.name: Classical Concert Series: NEC Philharmonia plays Sibelius, Walton & Dvorak
